result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca L. Fadroski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr:
Judgment for unpaid Restitution per 4/14/17 court order; Re: 

Charge: Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500)
Date of Loss: 11/15/15

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution to Sentry Foods on Lake Mills in the amount of $123

--to pay restitution processing fee
--no presence at the Sentry Foods in Lake Mills

--only grandchildren can live in the home of Ms. Fadroski

--the Court will leave to the discretion of the Agent, whether Ms. Fadroski's daughter and daughter's boyfriend may return to Ms. Fadroski's home, but only once they both have a full time job and are contributors to the household.

--take any medication prescribed by a physician or psychiartrist as prescribed

--comply with any assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--submit DNA sample upon demand 

Arresting Agency: Lake Mills PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

6/28/16: The Court orders that the JOC be amended to strike any provision not allowing Ms. Fadroski living with her daughter and anyone else Ms. Fadroski and daughter agree can live in household.

of Intent to Refer Debt to the WI Dept of Revenue, along with supporting Reminder Notices.

[MA]Case called at 11:51am
Defendant Rebecca L. Fadroski not in court.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance
The Court verifies receipt and review of the Defenant's letter submitted today.

ADA Hall gives position on Ms. Fadroski's probation
The Court indicates it will proceed with the Probation Review Hearing, as views Ms. Fadroski's letter as a lack of position on matter. 

The Court allows Mr. Fadroski to discharge from probation
The Court orders civil judgments in favor of victim as to unpaid restitution and the county as to unpaid costs/fees/assessments.
recess: 11:59am
from Defendant regarding not being able to appear today
Probation review hearing on March 20, 2017 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:22pm [mo]
Defendant Rebecca L. Fadroski in court.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent, Nina Hanfler present in courtroom gallery

On Defendant's Motion for Modification of Probation Conditions:
--ADA Shock indicates that the DA's office takes no position on the request
--The Court questions Agent Hanfler; Agent Hanfler indicates that there is a lack of objection

The Court orders that the JOC be amended to strike any provision not allowing Ms. Fadroski living with her daughter and anyone else Ms. Fadroski and daughter agree can live in household. 

recess: 1:30pm
Motion hearing on June 28, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
from Defendant re: Plea and Sentencing

Case called at 3:17pm [mo]
Defendant Rebecca L. Fadroski in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
--Ms. Fadroski indicates that she does not wish to have counsel

The Court concludes that Ms. Fadroski is competent to represent herself; the Court finds that Ms. Fadroski is knowingly and intelligently waiving her right to counsel.

Plea of "GUILTY" entered
Constitutional rights given; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Teuber

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--only grandchildren can live in the home of Ms. Fadroski
--the Court will leave to the discretion of the Agent, whether Ms. Fadroski's daughter and daughter's boyfriend may return to Ms. Fadroski's home, but only once they both have a full time job and are contributors to the household.
--take any medication prescribed by a physician or psychiartrist as prescribed
--to pay restitution to Sentry Foods on Lake Mills in the amount of $123
--no presence at the Sentry Foods in Lake Mills
--comply with any assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to pay statutory court costs, to include restitution processing fee
--submit DNA sample upon demand 
0 days credit

recess:3:45pm
